skills.skill: Work both independently and as a part of a team
Fluent in basic software programs (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
Solid understanding of basic accounting principles

duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain accurate accounting records for renewable energy and investment entity portfolios.
Support and complete Accounts Payable & Accounts Receivable functions as directed by the Manager.
Update internal systems with financial data.
Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
Enter weekly customer checks and GL posting.
Maintain purchase orders and reconcile vendor statements.
Support Month-End and Year-End closing, Annual Audit, and tax preparation.
Research, track, and restore accounting or documentation problems and discrepancies.
Maintain filing system for printed and electronic documents.
Generate customer invoices and distribute them on a monthly basis.
Collect W-9 forms for all vendor services and assist with end-of-year 1099 documents.
Manage and update a comprehensive financial management calendar.
Complete inputs to bookkeeping platform.
Download and save all financial statements, including bank and credit card statements.
Audit employee credit card receipts for documentation compliance.
Open and distribute incoming physical and electronic mail on a daily basis.
Answer phone calls, take messages, support scheduling, and set up conference lines as needed.
Prepare requested forms in accordance with company procedures.
Develop and maintain customer and partner relationships, gaining confidence, respect, and trust to support the mission.
Maintain an adequate office supply inventory and requisition additional items as needed.
Manage travel arrangements and accommodations for senior management as needed.
Complete research and data entry projects as assigned.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required. 1-3 years of accounting experience or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
